shine.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The moon shone brightly in the sky.
That lamp’s shining in my eyes.
shine.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if you shine a light somewhere, you point it in that direction
shine.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Shine that torch over here, will you?
shine.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Marion polished the table until it shone.
shine.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to make something bright by rubbing it
shine.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: His shoes were shined to perfection.
shine.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if your eyes shine, or your face shines, you have an expression of happiness
shine.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: ‘It was wonderful!’ Kate replied, her eyes shining with excitement.
shine.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: to be very good at something
shine.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: The concert will give young jazz musicians a chance to shine.
Peter didn’t really shine at school.
shine.translation[0].note_box[0].section: to shine brightly for a very short time, or to shine on and off very quickly many times
The police car’s lights were flashing.
to shine with a very strong light which hurts your eyes
The sun glared in her eyes.
to shine with an unsteady light – used about a flame or light
The candle flickered and went out.
if stars or lights twinkle, they shine in the dark in a way that seems to change from bright to faint, especially because you are a long way away from them
The harbour lights twinkled in the distance.
to shine with a warm soft light
The lights of the factory were still blazing.
if something sparkles, it shines with many small bright points when light is on it
The sea sparkled in the sunlight.
to shine by reflecting the light – used especially about smooth clean surfaces, or about someone’s eyes or teeth
His blue eyes gleamed with amusement.
to shine with quick flashes of light
The knife glinted in the sunlight.
to shine – used about wet or oily surfaces. Used especially when saying that someone’s eyes are full of tears, or someone’s skin is covered in sweat
As they were leaving, her eyes glistened with tears.
His forehead was glistening with sweat.
The wet chairs glistened in the afternoon sun.
if something catches the light, it shines because it is reflecting light
Her diamond ring caught the light.
shine.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the brightness that something has when light shines on it
shine.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Lucy’s dark hair seemed to have lost its shine.
